external.gw.xml

Interface XmlElement

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IGosuObject, IXmlMixedContent, XmlBase
    Deprecated. 
    External entities are deprecated. Please use the new Java API instead.

    @Deprecated
public interface XmlElement
extends IXmlMixedContent, XmlBase
    Represents an XML element. Unlike DOM, it does not directly contain any children. It has a backing XML type instance (XmlTypeInstance), however, which contains it's children. Call getTypeInstance() to access the backing type instance. All of the methods and properties of the backing type instance have been re-exposed on the XmlElement, however, so accessing the backing type instance directly should rarely be necessary.

      • asUTFString

        java.lang.String asUTFString()
        Deprecated. 
        Serializes this element to a string. The returned string is in a format suitable for byte conversion to either UTF-8 or UTF-16 (with a leading byte order mark to indicate endianness). The use of getBytes() is highly recommended over the use of this method.
        Returns:
        a string containing the serialized XML

      • asUTFString

        java.lang.String asUTFString(XmlSerializationOptions options)
        Deprecated. 
        Serializes this element to a string. The returned string is in a format suitable for byte conversion to either UTF-8 or UTF-16 (with a leading byte order mark to indicate endianness). The use of getBytes() is highly recommended over the use of this method.
        Parameters:
        options - the options to control serialization
        Returns:
        a string containing the serialized XML

      • declareNamespace

        void declareNamespace(XmlNamespace ns)
        Deprecated. 
        Explicitly declares an XML namespace and a suggested prefix at this level. The prefix that actually ends up being bound to the namespace may not be the same as the suggested prefix.
        Parameters:
        ns - the XmlNamespace that contains the namespace URI to be declared and the suggested prefix to which the namespace should be bound
